intro: Carex annectens, commonly known as the common sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and along stream banks. Carex annectens produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikelets, which are usually wind-pollinated. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
